| past_members = [[Chino & Nacho|El Chino]]
[[Chino & Nacho|Nacho]]
| notable_instruments = }} '''Calle Ciega''' was a [[reggaeton]] [[boy band]] from [[Venezuela]]. It started early in 1998 with [[Merengue music|merengue]] [[hip hop music|hip hop]], ending its evolution in a mix of dance reggaeton with a unique Venezuelan "flow". The group had five elements: Nacho, El Chino, Luifer, Kent and Emilio. All of them coming from different cities in Venezuela and from other musical projects. Their hit single "Mi Cachorrita" has been number one for more than 23 weeks in Venezuela, and for more than 35 in the top 20 of that country's ''Record Report''. Right now, Calle Ciega has started their international tour to support the record deal they inked with Prisma Records in [[Miami, Florida|Miami]], [[Florida]]. Their recent visit to Miami in a promotional tour, was noticed by the media, and they are scheduled to come back in October. Meanwhile they continue to do shows in Venezuela and are gaining popularity in [[Peru]], [[Ecuador]] and [[Colombia]], where they are the opening act for top Reggaeton stars [[Daddy Yankee]], [[Mey Vidal]], and [[Ivy Queen]]. == Albums == * ''[[No Pares de Sudar]]'' (1999) * ''[[Caliente (Calle Ciega album)|Caliente]]'' (2000) * ''Grandes Exitos'' (2001) * ''Seguimos Bailando'' (2002) * ''La Carcajada'' (2004) * ''[[Una Vez MÃ¡s (album)|Una Vez MÃ¡s]]'' (2006) * ''[[MÃ¡s Caliente]]'' (2007) ==Singles== *''"Mi Cachorrita"'' *''"Como te extraÃ±a mi cama"'' *''"El Vestido Rojo"'' *''"La Pastillita"'' *''"Dile"'' ==External links== * {{fr icon}} [http://scolas.skyrock.com/480026547-Calle-Ciega.html On Wikimusique] {{Refimprove|date=August 2007}} [[Category:Musical groups established in 1998]] [[Category:Musical groups disestablished in 2007]] [[Category:Reggaeton musicians]] [[Category:Venezuelan musical groups]] [[de:Calle Ciega]] [[fr:Calle Ciega]] [[it:Calle Ciega]] [[nl:Calle Ciega]]
